name: GCSE and equivalent results in England, 2012 to 2013 (revised)

resources.description: Table 1a: Time series of GCSE and equivalent entries and achievements. Years: 1995/96 to 2012/131 (Revised). Coverage: England.
notes: The years include entries and achievements in previous academic years.
Figures for 2012/13 are revised, all other figures are final.

fields.name: number-of-pupils
notes: Number of pupils on roll aged 15 at the start of the academic year or at the end of key stage 4.

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-C
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-C or equivalent

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-C-incl-english-and-maths
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-C or equivalent including English and mathematics GCSEs
notes: From 2009/2010 iGCSEs, accredited at time of publication, have been counted as GCSE equivalents and also as English & mathematics GCSEs. Also provided are 2009/10 figures without iGCSEs to be consistent with earlier years’ data.

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-G
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-G or equivalent

fields.name: 5plus-GCSE-A-G-incl-english-and-maths
fields.description: Percentage who achieved 5+ GCSEs A*-G or equivalent including English and mathematics GCSEs4
notes: From 2009/2010 iGCSEs, accredited at time of publication, have been counted as GCSE equivalents and also as English & mathematics GCSEs. Also provided are 2009/10 figures without iGCSEs to be consistent with earlier years’ data.

fields.name: any-passes
fields.description: Percentage of any passes

resources.description: Top section of table 1b: The English Baccalaureate - By gender
notes: Figures for 2012/13 are revised, all other figures are final.

All schools include state-funded schools, independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

State-funded schools include academies, free schools, city technology colleges and state-funded special schools but exclude independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

resources.description: Bottom section of table 1b: The English Baccalaureate - By subject
notes: Figures for 2012/13 are revised, all other figures are final.

All schools include state-funded schools, independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

State-funded schools include academies, free schools, city technology colleges and state-funded special schools but exclude independent schools, independent special schools, non-maintained special schools, hospital schools and alternative provision including academy and free school alternative provision and pupil referral units.

The figures for pupils achieving the English and mathematics subject areas are calculated as a percentage of pupils at the end of key stage 4. The figures for sciences, history or geography and languages achievements are calculated as a percentage of those pupils who were entered in that subject area.

fields.name: subject
notes: Triple science includes biology, physics and chemistry. To note, pupils achieving any two of these subjects are counted in the component of Ebacc science.
